parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and seio; to sway downward, i.e. Make a signal.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phoneo; to sound towards, i.e. Address, exclaim, summon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The Hebrew language, or rather: Aramaic. From Eber; the Hebraistic or Jewish language.
